posts.title: Couple sentenced to hundreds of years in prison for forcing adopted Black children to work as 'slaves'
top_comments:
> Whitefeather apologized to the children during the sentencing.
"I just want the court to know that I have made mistakes I am very sorry for that and I love my children and I have never, ever, done anything to my ... children to harm them intentionally,” she said, according to WSAZ. “Children, I do love you.”

Imagine forcing children into slavery, locking them in sheds, and abusing them horribly. Keeping them dirty, cold, and hungry. Then trying to tell your victims you didn't hurt them, and you love them. Lying and manipulation from an absolute monster. I hope those kids get the best support and help they possibly can, they've been through hell. May they find some happiness while these two rot.

And then they tried to blame the real estate agent for not finding them a house secluded enough.

How can people be so evil.

>"May God have mercy on your souls, because this court will not,” Circuit Court Judge Mary Claire Akers said...

That is a badass line.
How many times must I ask WTF is wrong with people? How did this world just produce so many pieces of shit. Sigh.

Every time I see people who abuse children and teens in their care and someone chides me about doing foster care when I retire "Are you SURE YOU could handle being a foster mom?" 

And I think "At least I'm not planning to abuse them as SLAVES and at worst mayne build them a savings account, feed and clothe them, tutor them, then help them go to college or join the military at 18?"
Please say 400 years....it'd be so...  appropriate

Meanwhile in pennsylvania... Two judges ran a scheme called Kids for Cash. They sentenced children, as young as eight, to for-profit prisons. For millions in kickbacks from the prisons. Crimes such as jaywalking, truancy, and petty theft. 2300 children. The judges went to jail. Briefly. They were disgracefully pardoned and are currently out enjoying their freedoms. Two tier justice.

Whitefeather’s attorney, Mark Plants, said during closing arguments that the couple was only guilty of making poor parenting decisions.

“These are farm people that do farm chores,” Plants said. “It wasn’t about race. It wasn’t about forced labor.”

Christ all fucking mighty I accept this dude has a job to do but did he say that and expect to be taken seriously?
I'm surprised they didn't get a cabinet position instead

*The oldest child told Whitefeather and Lantz in an impact statement that they were “monsters,” the news station reported.*

*“I will be something amazing,” another child said. “I will be strong and beautiful. You will always be exactly what you are — horrible.”*

I hope these children can heal and thrive. The absolute ghouls of humans (the parents) to even think of this as a valid idea.

posts.title: IRS braces for $500bn drop in revenue as taxpayers skip filings in wake of DOGE cuts
top_comments: Simple tax returns are audited by computer.  It's the difficult returns that need analysis.  The rich will get away with more as intended.

For anyone considering this - just be aware that the fines for not filing are quite high: “The failure-to-file penalty is usually 5% of the tax owed for each month your return is overdue, up to 25% of the bill.” ([IRS policy here](https://www.irs.gov/payments/failure-to-file-penalty))

I’m not sure if they’ll have the staff to go after folks later but tax issues are known to pop up and bite you many years later. You may not hear anything for a decade and then suddenly get a bill.
Republicans would be happy to starve to federal government and use that as an excuse to cut programs and services
I feel like an idiot paying for estimated taxes
I decided if they are going to cut the Dept. of Education, I'm not going to worry about paying my DOE loans...seems fair.
Do they even have the resources to go after non-payers?

Am I understanding that because people see a reduction in staff at the IRS, they are going to skip filing their tax returns???  This is a guess since (as usual) the story is lacking details beyond "an increasing number of taxpayers could skip submitting their filings". 

So these rocket scientist think that if the IRS doesn't have the staff right now to notice that someone didn't file a return that they are somehow off the hook?  They will be in for a big surprise when a few years from now, the IRS comes for any back taxes, penalties and interest.  

And if you overpaid taxes during the year (like the majority of taxpayers do), then by not filing your annual return, you won't get a refund.

So let's see

We have citizens saying we shouldn't pay taxes, we won't get caught. We have states saying we should withhold fed taxes if trump plays games with funding, especially in giver states. We have federal officials ignoring federal judges rulings because they thought they could ignore a verbal judgement (latest excuse) and illegally deporting people. We are dismantling the department of education. The president did a car advertisement for a ketamine addict at the white house. All of our allies are breaking off trade, opting for non american weapons and tech, and are issuing travel warnings to dissuade tourists from going to the US.

In short we have a major breakdown in both rule of law as well as respect for the federal government and democracy.

It has only been 60 days since Jan 20th.

Wouldn’t failure to file result in fines, thereby increasing revenue?

If you can’t afford to audit someone then just use their prior year’s filing in addition to the fine. Throw in a monthly late fee until they file and you’ll probably see a surplus in revenue.
No taxation without representation!

"drug smuggling"

WTF? 

You'd have to be on drugs to think this library could or would be an effective drug smuggling route.  This is just animosity towards Canada for no logistical or logical reason other than to be ass.

And to be honest this constant drug smuggling claim levied towards Canada makes me nervous, I get the distinct feeling trump wants a guns and boots conflict with Canada

I think the US's canary died a while ago. At this point, it's just a bunch of toxic gas in this coal mine.
Nice folks you have down there
Such needless aggression and division.
Trumpism is synonymous with pettiness and belligerence. Complete and utter assholes are running the United States now.

Meanwhile, Alaska:

posts.title: Pa. fire chief charged after dropping baby, fracturing her skull
top_comments:
Not a great headline. Dropping would imply he lost control of her weight and accidentally let her fall to the ground. That would be tragic, but understandable since babies can often throw themselves unpredictably if you are not careful. I have two of my own and have had both of them attempt to yeet from my arms.

No, this guy THREW his 3-month-old daughter to the ground after pulling her roughly out of a swing, hard enough to crack her skull. Because she was crying. Fuck this guy! Straight to jail!
He THREW his infant on the ground.  He didn't drop her.

> It was divulged during that interview that he in fact had taken the child from what’s being described as a swing forcefully and then took the child out and then threw the child on the ground as being overly frustrated and child wouldn’t stop crying and was being very fussy at the time," Falls Township Police Detective Dennis O'Connell said.

Imagine the horror mom felt going to work, and then finding out her husband did this to their baby instead of caring for her.

Do people not know that you can just put the baby in a crib and shut the door for a while if you can’t deal with a baby crying. 
It’s that easy.

>Investigators said that Falls Township Fire Chief Brian Salt admitted to **intentionally letting his three-month-old daughter fall from his arms** and hitting her head on the ground on March 11.

What the fuck kind of reporting is this. He *intentionally let* her fall?!

Not all first responders are heroes.

Not by a long shot.
Who wrote that headline? He threw his own 3 month old baby to the ground because the baby was "fussy". Being a fire chief has sweet fuck all to do with it. Jesus fucking keerist.
Threw. He threw his own 3 month old.
Are NBC journalists and editors unaware of what “dropping” means and how that’s different from “throwing”?
It doesnt mention in the article if the child lived or is okay

posts.title: Mark Carney triggers federal election for Canada - National | Globalnews.ca
top_comments:
The bots are out in force, saying that Mark Carney was not elected properly as prime minister.

This is perfectly acceptable — in Canada, like in the UK, we elect the PARTY not the Prime Minister. The party leader becomes prime minister.

Additional context.

In the UK, Rishi Sunak became Prime Minister after Liz Truss stepped down, and then stayed as Prime Minister from 2022-2024 — a total of two years of being an "unelected" Conservative PM.

In Canada, Brian Mulroney stepped down in 1993 and Kim Campbell became head of the Conservative party, and thus Prime Minister, in June 1993. She was an "unelected" Conservative PM until October 25, 1993 — a total of 132 days.

Mark Carney was sworn in as PM of Canada on March 14, and called an election 9 days later, on March 23. The election will take place on April 28. From March 14 to April 28, 2025, is 45 days. This was completely expected for him to do.

Unlike what the disinfo bots are going to tell us, It is not a surprise election, and it is not a coup.

\*Holds a finger up in the air\*

Oh look it feels like a liberal wind blowing.

Give Trump hell Canada!
As a dual citizen I love Canadian elections! In the U.S. they are now measured in years. Here they’re just a few weeks :)

Hahah watching PPs address in the video in the article is both hilarious and painful to watch. Uses same phrasing as trump and even trips up by saying Carney and trump are in total “disagreement” and then tries to correct himself. Such a weak traitor. Make no mistake guys, a vote for PP is a vote for Trump and a vote against Canada.
If he wins do you think he could make the US the eleventh province?
The U.S. needs to ditch it’s “democracy in name only” and go to something similar to Canada’s.
This is smart. It's not a given that the Liberal Party will maintain their momentum, so best to pull the trigger now, rather than in October.
In coming crazy month in Canada
Why was P.Poilievre cut from every basketball team? Couldn't pivot.
So how long until PP complains the election is too early, after calling for an election for months and months?

posts.title: IRS nearing agreement to use its data to help ICE locate undocumented migrants | CNN Politics
top_comments: Time to crack down on those damn tax-payers.
So in the future when anyone says that it's safe to give your data because it won't be used for immigration enforcment, only an idiot would believe those assurances?

This is going to be bad for the budget. Currently the fact that the IRS promises not to share data with immigration enforcement for people who voluntarily report taxes is responsible for almost $100b in revenue from people who can't claim most benefits of their tax dollars. Letting these people pay taxes benefits other taxpayers and breaking this trust just vindicates those who chose to hide their income.

It seems (numbers aren't forthcoming) that the administration never intended to follow through on its promise of targeting criminals first, because those engaging with the system in good faith (going to all their immigration/asylum hearings, paying their taxes, etc.) are easier to track down to pad the numbers.

I cannot stress how horrifically stupid this decision is because at the end of the day, the IRS must be an apolitical agency to even function; the moment your tax statements can be used for political persecution of any kind, is a moment where the entire tax system collapses.

Never mind the fact that illegal immigrants who pay into social security through fake identities are literally a net benefit to social security because they can't collect those benefits so its just a positive to the system (still messed up to be clear, but its the reality of our situation).

There's only one reason to do this sort of thing: to further the collapse of social security and sow immense distrust in the American taxation system for income tax. There's also the simpler fact that, due the nature of *how* illegal immigrants file their taxes, any attempt to scoop them up through the IRS data is going to scoop up a *lot* of US citizens that happen to "fit the profile" assuming they maintain their current "move fast and break things" attitude about civil rights.
If the IRS has a file on them, how undocumented are they?
If they are illegal and paying taxes. Shouldn't they be going after their employers?
Whoa I thought these "illeguls" were just freeloaders who didn't pay taxes! /S

So the assurances from the IRS they won't won't share information on your taxes with others no longer applies. If someone is a sex worker they better not report any earnings from tips since law enforcement could ask the IRS to voluntarily give information on people who received tips from possible sex work so that they can arrest them. A politician could request information from the IRS on people who have donated to a rival political organization in order to place these people on a political retaliation hit list.

Trump promised repeatedly to deport tens of millions. Some rationalized it by saying he would only really go after the criminals. Turns out he’s going after the lowest hanging fruit, which is not criminals.
But... but... illegals don't pay taxes, right?

posts.title: Walk-in cooler fire causes smoke plume above France Pavilion at Disney World’s Epcot park
top_comments: Did Disney elect a new Pope?
Management has asked us to remind kitchen staff that only one employee may use the walk in for smoke break at a time. If everyone goes at once, accidents like this happen.

As a refrigeration technician, I wonder if this system was using an A2L refrigerant. A2L's are mildly flammable. Keep in mind smaller refrigeration systems have been using propane as a refrigerant for a few years now.
So who let Goofy cook.
The French pavilion? Just tell the guests it's cigarette smoke.
Oh no, the grey stuff is black now
Ironic... It could save others from heat, but not itself.

Used to work in this pavilion, those walk ins were dated 10 years ago. I can only imagine how bad they got by now. I remember one time I got trapped in one for an hour before someone came to look for me.
At that point half of France surrendered and have agreed to rule France in Disney’s best interest.

posts.title: IRS braces for $500bn drop in revenue as taxpayers skip filings in wake of DOGE cuts
top_comments: Simple tax returns are audited by computer.  It's the difficult returns that need analysis.  The rich will get away with more as intended.

For anyone considering this - just be aware that the fines for not filing are quite high: “The failure-to-file penalty is usually 5% of the tax owed for each month your return is overdue, up to 25% of the bill.” ([IRS policy here](https://www.irs.gov/payments/failure-to-file-penalty))

I’m not sure if they’ll have the staff to go after folks later but tax issues are known to pop up and bite you many years later. You may not hear anything for a decade and then suddenly get a bill.
Republicans would be happy to starve to federal government and use that as an excuse to cut programs and services
I feel like an idiot paying for estimated taxes
I decided if they are going to cut the Dept. of Education, I'm not going to worry about paying my DOE loans...seems fair.
Do they even have the resources to go after non-payers?

Am I understanding that because people see a reduction in staff at the IRS, they are going to skip filing their tax returns???  This is a guess since (as usual) the story is lacking details beyond "an increasing number of taxpayers could skip submitting their filings". 

So these rocket scientist think that if the IRS doesn't have the staff right now to notice that someone didn't file a return that they are somehow off the hook?  They will be in for a big surprise when a few years from now, the IRS comes for any back taxes, penalties and interest.  

And if you overpaid taxes during the year (like the majority of taxpayers do), then by not filing your annual return, you won't get a refund.

So let's see

We have citizens saying we shouldn't pay taxes, we won't get caught. We have states saying we should withhold fed taxes if trump plays games with funding, especially in giver states. We have federal officials ignoring federal judges rulings because they thought they could ignore a verbal judgement (latest excuse) and illegally deporting people. We are dismantling the department of education. The president did a car advertisement for a ketamine addict at the white house. All of our allies are breaking off trade, opting for non american weapons and tech, and are issuing travel warnings to dissuade tourists from going to the US.

In short we have a major breakdown in both rule of law as well as respect for the federal government and democracy.

It has only been 60 days since Jan 20th.

Wouldn’t failure to file result in fines, thereby increasing revenue?

If you can’t afford to audit someone then just use their prior year’s filing in addition to the fine. Throw in a monthly late fee until they file and you’ll probably see a surplus in revenue.
No taxation without representation!

posts.title: IRS nearing agreement to use its data to help ICE locate undocumented migrants | CNN Politics
top_comments: Time to crack down on those damn tax-payers.
So in the future when anyone says that it's safe to give your data because it won't be used for immigration enforcment, only an idiot would believe those assurances?

This is going to be bad for the budget. Currently the fact that the IRS promises not to share data with immigration enforcement for people who voluntarily report taxes is responsible for almost $100b in revenue from people who can't claim most benefits of their tax dollars. Letting these people pay taxes benefits other taxpayers and breaking this trust just vindicates those who chose to hide their income.

It seems (numbers aren't forthcoming) that the administration never intended to follow through on its promise of targeting criminals first, because those engaging with the system in good faith (going to all their immigration/asylum hearings, paying their taxes, etc.) are easier to track down to pad the numbers.

I cannot stress how horrifically stupid this decision is because at the end of the day, the IRS must be an apolitical agency to even function; the moment your tax statements can be used for political persecution of any kind, is a moment where the entire tax system collapses.

Never mind the fact that illegal immigrants who pay into social security through fake identities are literally a net benefit to social security because they can't collect those benefits so its just a positive to the system (still messed up to be clear, but its the reality of our situation).

There's only one reason to do this sort of thing: to further the collapse of social security and sow immense distrust in the American taxation system for income tax. There's also the simpler fact that, due the nature of *how* illegal immigrants file their taxes, any attempt to scoop them up through the IRS data is going to scoop up a *lot* of US citizens that happen to "fit the profile" assuming they maintain their current "move fast and break things" attitude about civil rights.
If the IRS has a file on them, how undocumented are they?
If they are illegal and paying taxes. Shouldn't they be going after their employers?
Whoa I thought these "illeguls" were just freeloaders who didn't pay taxes! /S

So the assurances from the IRS they won't won't share information on your taxes with others no longer applies. If someone is a sex worker they better not report any earnings from tips since law enforcement could ask the IRS to voluntarily give information on people who received tips from possible sex work so that they can arrest them. A politician could request information from the IRS on people who have donated to a rival political organization in order to place these people on a political retaliation hit list.

posts.title: Mark Carney triggers federal election for Canada - National | Globalnews.ca
top_comments:
The bots are out in force, saying that Mark Carney was not elected properly as prime minister.

This is perfectly acceptable — in Canada, like in the UK, we elect the PARTY not the Prime Minister. The party leader becomes prime minister.

Additional context.

In the UK, Rishi Sunak became Prime Minister after Liz Truss stepped down, and then stayed as Prime Minister from 2022-2024 — a total of two years of being an "unelected" Conservative PM.

In Canada, Brian Mulroney stepped down in 1993 and Kim Campbell became head of the Conservative party, and thus Prime Minister, in June 1993. She was an "unelected" Conservative PM until October 25, 1993 — a total of 132 days.

Mark Carney was sworn in as PM of Canada on March 14, and called an election 9 days later, on March 23. The election will take place on April 28. From March 14 to April 28, 2025, is 45 days. This was completely expected for him to do.

Unlike what the disinfo bots are going to tell us, It is not a surprise election, and it is not a coup.

\*Holds a finger up in the air\*

Oh look it feels like a liberal wind blowing.

Give Trump hell Canada!
As a dual citizen I love Canadian elections! In the U.S. they are now measured in years. Here they’re just a few weeks :)

Hahah watching PPs address in the video in the article is both hilarious and painful to watch. Uses same phrasing as trump and even trips up by saying Carney and trump are in total “disagreement” and then tries to correct himself. Such a weak traitor. Make no mistake guys, a vote for PP is a vote for Trump and a vote against Canada.
If he wins do you think he could make the US the eleventh province?
The U.S. needs to ditch it’s “democracy in name only” and go to something similar to Canada’s.
This is smart. It's not a given that the Liberal Party will maintain their momentum, so best to pull the trigger now, rather than in October.
In coming crazy month in Canada

So how long until PP complains the election is too early, after calling for an election for months and months?
